online.common
Class exCanvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Canvas
          online.common.exCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible, online.common.deferredEventHandler, online.common.OnlineConstants
public abstract class exCanvas
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.util.Observer, online.common.OnlineConstants, online.common.deferredEventHandler

Excanvas is the base class used by both the lobby and game windows.

Author:
ddyer
See Also:
Serialized Form

runThread

public java.lang.Thread runThread
this is the thtead executing the viewerRun method. Since the basic model requires that everything happens in this thread, code where you suspect "leakage" in to other processes can check.

See Also:

a #exHashtable of things shared among many parts of the program. In games, this is primarily used for parameters passed from the lobby.

theRoot

public online.common.RootAppletProtocol theRoot
the root applet for the game. Some image and sound operations have to be provided by the applet. There are also some error reporting utilities here.

LAST_IS_NULL

public static final int LAST_IS_NULL
integer code indicating the state of the mouse for MouseMotion(int, int, int). LAST_IS_NULL is supplied when the mouse hasn't changed state at all, but there has been no mouse activity for a while.

See Also:
LAST_IS_MOVE, LAST_IS_DOWN, LAST_IS_DRAG, LAST_IS_UP, LAST_IS_NULL, Constant Field Values

LAST_IS_MOVE

public static final int LAST_IS_MOVE
integer code indicating the state of the mouse for MouseMotion(int, int, int). LAST_IS_MOVE is supplied when the mouse may have moved while the button is up.

See Also:
LAST_IS_MOVE, LAST_IS_DOWN, LAST_IS_DRAG, LAST_IS_UP, LAST_IS_NULL, Constant Field Values

LAST_IS_DRAG

public static final int LAST_IS_DRAG
integer code indicating the state of the mouse for MouseMotion(int, int, int). LAST_IS_DRAG is supplied when the mouse may have moved while the button is down.

See Also:
LAST_IS_MOVE, LAST_IS_DOWN, LAST_IS_DRAG, LAST_IS_UP, LAST_IS_NULL, Constant Field Values

LAST_IS_UP

public static final int LAST_IS_UP
integer code indicating the state of the mouse for MouseMotion(int, int, int). LAST_IS_UP is supplied when the mouse button has transitioned from down to up

See Also:

preloadImages

public void preloadImages()
this method should be superceeded by the canvas to load images at initialization time. It's expected to call lockAndLoadImages(online.common.RootAppletProtocol)

lockAndLoadImages

public void lockAndLoadImages(online.common.RootAppletProtocol root)
preload static images. This had better have only minimal dependency on the real environment, because we only load the root and sharedinfo. This loads static variables, and may be invoked by a class preloader, or by the startup of the actual class, so we been to be careful to synchronize through a static variable

Parameters:
root -

Parameters:

handleDeferredEvent

public boolean handleDeferredEvent(java.lang.Object target,
                                   java.lang.String command)
handle an event that was deferred. This is a visitor method to handle menu items, both fixed and popup.

Specified by:
handleDeferredEvent in interface online.common.deferredEventHandler
Parameters:
target - the object that was target of the menu event
command - the command string from the menu event
Returns:
true if the event was handled.

StartDragging

public abstract void StartDragging(online.common.HitPoint hp)
StartDragging is called from the default version of MouseMotion(int, int, int) when the mouse button is down and the mouse moves, or when the mouse button is released (possibly without being moved). The intended interface for your canvas to use StartDragging to trigger events which involve picking up and moving an object.

Parameters:
hp -
See Also:
StopDragging(online.common.HitPoint)

StopDragging

public abstract void StopDragging(online.common.HitPoint hp)
StopDragging is called when the mouse button transitions from down to up. The intended interface is to use StopDragging to trigger clicks on buttons and other objects that do not move.

Parameters:
hp -
See Also:
StartDragging(online.common.HitPoint)

SetHighlight

public online.common.HitPoint SetHighlight(online.common.HitPoint p)

MouseMotion

public abstract online.common.HitPoint MouseMotion(int eventx,
                                                   int eventy,
                                                   int upcode)
This is called from the viewer event loop when there is any mouse activity that needs to be handled. The mecanics guarantee that every "down" will be matches by an "up", and every down or up will be followed by a "move".

Parameters:
eventx - is the mouse x
eventy - is the mouse y
upcode - is an integer code indicating the state of the mouse, one of LAST_IS_MOVE, LAST_IS_DOWN, LAST_IS_DRAG, LAST_IS_UP or LAST_IS_NULL

getCachedImage

public java.awt.Image getCachedImage(java.awt.Image im,
                                     int w,
                                     int h)
get a cached and scaled copy of image im. This depends on im being a static image. This method always returns immediately, initially with the original image, then eventually the carefully scaled copy becomes available and is used on subsequent drawing requests.

Parameters:
im -
w -
h -
Returns:
a cached image to display

ViewerRun

public void ViewerRun()
this is the run loop for the window. All significant events should occur here. Actions due to network, mouse, or keyboard should be deferred and handled here. Canvas painting is also deferred and handles here.

About the only thing that doesn't happen here is activity by robots to search for next moves.

See Also:
handleDeferredEvent(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String), paintCanvas(java.awt.Graphics, boolean, online.common.HitPoint)

displayClipped

public void displayClipped(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                           java.awt.Rectangle include,
                           java.awt.Rectangle exclude,
                           java.awt.Image im)
this is a method to bridge some functionality that only becomes available with java 1.2. Before java 1.2, only rectangular clipping regions are supported. Since we typically want to display a rectangle with a hole in in (hole corresponds to the chat area) we need more.

Parameters:
gc -
include -
exclude -
im -

drawImage

public void drawImage(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                      java.awt.Image im,
                      double[] scale,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      double boxw,
                      double xscale,
                      double jitter,
                      java.lang.String text,
                      boolean artCenterText)
this is the primary method to draw an images with transparent backgrounds on a canvas. The images are clipped to a slightly smaller box to avoid the "edge garbage" bug.

Another feature of this interface is that the images are displayed quickly at first, then "slow scaled" to the desired size.

Parameters:
gc - the graphics context
im - the image to draw
scale - the x,y offset and scale factor to expand or shrink the image
x - the x coordinate to draw at
y - the y coordinate to draw at
boxw - the box width to draw
xscale - separate x scale for nonuniform scaling on the x axis
jitter - percentage of size to jitter the image position
text - text to draw over the image
artCenterText - if true center the text in the box, otherwise at the art center

adjustScales

public boolean adjustScales(double[] pscale,
                            java.lang.Object piece)

getAltChipset

public int getAltChipset()
This is the key method for defining alternate sets of artwork based on the StockArt class. At a very low level, just before the canvas draws an image based on StockArt, it calls getAltChip. These two methods work together to make appropriate substututions in the artwork.

The meaning of the alternate chip index, and the nature of the substitutions made, are a matter of agreement between your canvas and chip classes.

Returns:
a chipset index (default 0)
See Also:
getAltChip

drawBubble

public void drawBubble(java.awt.Graphics inG,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       java.lang.String msg,
                       java.awt.Rectangle r)
draw a tooltip bubble with the pointer pointing to x,y, constrained to appear in rectangle R. Text must be a single line of text and. The position of the pointer is adjusted appropriately if the x,y is too close to the edges of the rectangle. should be brief.

Parameters:
inG - the graphics to draw
x - the x of the focus of attention
y - the y of the focus of attention
msg - the text to be displayed
r - the bounding rectangle

DrawArrow

public void DrawArrow(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                      online.common.HitPoint hp)
draw any StockArt that was specified by adding annotions to the hitpoint. Also draw a tooltip if one is specified and the mouse has been stationary more than idleTimeout milliseconds.

Parameters:
gc - the graphics context
hp - the hit point
